snippet: Britain remains among the stingiest of European countries when it comes to responding to those seeking asylum, and is planning more restrictive measures aimed at further deterring migrants.
abstract: Analysis of Great Britain’s response to European migrant crisis shows it to be meager in comparison to actions of Germany, Sweden and other wealthy nations; critics cite Britain's harsh policies towards asylum seekers, including cutback in benefits, tightly controlled living conditions and increased rates of deportation.

byline.contributor: Steven Erlanger contributed reporting from London.

lead_paragraph: Britain remains among the stingiest of European countries when it comes to responding to those seeking asylum, and is planning more restrictive measures aimed at further deterring migrants.

headline.main: Britain Tries to Deter Migrants, Even as It Lets More In
headline.print_headline: Britain Tries to Deter Migrants, Even as It Lets More In

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
